commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code quality by refactoring Event
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactored the Event class to enhance code readability,
maintainability and abstraction. The following changes
were made:

- Extracted redundant code blocks into parseEventDate method
- Improved method naming for better clarity and self-documentation

These improvements aim to make the codebase cleaner, easier to understand,
and more maintainable, reducing the likelihood of bugs and making
future enhancements easier.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-CodeQuality' into master to improve code quality
commitResults.messageBody:
This merge incorporates changes from `branch-A-CodeQuality` into the
`master` branch to improve the overall code quality of the project.
The following enhancements and refactorings have been made:

- Refactored `Event` to adhere to SOLID principles.
- Extracted duplicated code blocks into reusable helper methods to
  reduce redundancy.
- Improved method naming for better clarity and readability.
- Simplified complex conditional statements and control flows for
  better maintainability.
- Ensured proper encapsulation by making fields and methods private
  where appropriate.

These improvements aim to make the codebase more readable, maintainable,
and scalable, reducing the likelihood of bugs and making future
enhancements easier to implement.
Improve code quality by refactoring Event

commitResults.messageTitle: Add functionality to snooze, postpone, and reschedule tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit introduces a new feature that allows users to easily
snooze, postpone, or reschedule tasks in the application. The following
changes have been made to implement this feature:

- Added `RescheduleCommand` class to handle rescheduling logic for tasks.
- Updated `Task`, `Deadlines`, and `Event` classes to support changing
  due dates and start/end dates with new `reschedule` methods.
- Modified the `Parser` class to parse user input for reschedule commands
  and create appropriate `RescheduleCommand` instances.
- Enhanced the `Ui` class to provide user feedback when tasks are
  successfully rescheduled or when errors occur (e.g., invalid date format
  or invalid task index).
- Ensured that the `Storage` class saves the updated task list after
  rescheduling tasks.

With these changes, users can now use commands like `reschedule` to
modify the dates of tasks and events in a user-friendly manner. This
improves the flexibility and usability of the application.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add README for LeBron James ChatBot User Guide
commitResults.messageBody:
Added a comprehensive README file for the LeBron James ChatBot project, detailing the usage and features of the chatbot. The README includes:

- Introduction and product overview that incorporates LeBron James-themed jargon.
- Instructions on adding deadlines with examples and expected outcomes.
- Instructions on adding events with usage examples and outcomes.
- Detailed descriptions of the core task management features such as adding, deleting, marking, and unmarking tasks.
- Feature descriptions for searching tasks (find) and listing all tasks (list), with usage examples.
- Explanation of the 'stats' feature for monitoring productivity.
- Encouraging language that aligns with LeBron James' basketball persona to make the user guide engaging and thematic.

This README will serve as a user guide for new users and contributors to understand the chatbot's functionality and how to use its features effectively.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code quality by renaming boolean variables for clarity
commitResults.messageBody:
- Renamed boolean variables to follow best practices for boolean naming conventions, improving readability and maintainability.
  - Changed `done` to `isDone`

These changes enhance the code's readability by ensuring that boolean variable names clearly convey their state (e.g., using "is", "has", "can"). This refactoring is part of an ongoing effort to improve overall code quality and consistency.

commitResults.messageTitle: Revise and improve README for LeBron James ChatBot
commitResults.messageBody:
- Refactored the README file to enhance clarity and readability.
- Fixed formatting issues and added missing details for certain commands.
- Ensured that all usage examples have corresponding expected outcomes for better user understanding.

These changes improve the documentation quality and provide clearer guidance to users, aligning the README with best practices for user guides and enhancing the overall onboarding experience.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error handling for missing arguments in Parser class
commitResults.messageBody:
- Implemented a try-catch block in the parse method of the Parser class
- Added handling for ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when commands that require arguments (e.g., delete, mark, unmark, find, etc.) are missing additional input (words[1])
- Throws a LeBronException with a user-friendly message ("The command is missing arguments, bro!") when arguments are not provided
- Ensured the application handles missing command arguments gracefully, improving user experience and error feedback
